instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20v and 0.08a
threads.message:
Logic board is perfect, no oxidation.

Recognizes in DFU mode but does not complete (revive and restore)

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.30v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> - 0

I checked the <CHIP>U6960</CHIP>
pin 11 - 12.30v
pin 10 - fluctuating between 10 and 11.8v
pin 13 - 5v
pin 5 - 0.8v

changed the <CHIP>U6960</CHIP>, voltages did not change.

checked the <RESISTOR>R6970</RESISTOR>-73

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20v and 0.08a
threads.message:
What error did you get in DFU?
Be aware, sometime DFU may complete after several days trying...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20v and 0.08a
threads.message:
Error DFU:
Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU state. [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFCA (4042)]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20v and 0.08a
threads.message: Flash SoC ROM and try DFU again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20v and 0.08a
threads.message: can you help me with SoC ROM? My first time with this process. I searched the forum, read about different adapter because of 1.8v.
